content.title: Portal Vein Resection and Reconstruction
content.definition: Surgical resection of portal vein or superior mesenteric vein (SMV) involved by pancreatic or periampullary tumors, with vascular reconstruction to achieve negative margins.

key_concepts.description: Tumor abutment >180° or short-segment occlusion of SMV-portal vein is considered borderline resectable if reconstructible.
Type 1: Focal, <180° involvement. Type 2: Short segment, >180°. Type 3: Long segment. Type 4: Splenic vein confluence involvement.
Primary end-to-end, lateral venorrhaphy, patch repair, interposition graft (autologous or prosthetic).

assessment.preoperative: High-quality CT/MRI to assess extent and plan resection
assessment.intraoperative: Assess tumor mobility, portal vein involvement extent, need for arterial resection

tangential.technique: Partial resection of vein wall with lateral venorrhaphy or patch

segmental.technique: Complete transection with primary end-to-end or interposition graft

primary_anastomosis.technique: End-to-end with 5-0 or 6-0 polypropylene, running or interrupted

patch_venoplasty.conduit: Internal jugular vein, peritoneum, bovine pericardium

interposition_graft.indication: Gap too large for primary repair

splenic_vein_management.preservation: Anastomose to graft or reimplant if possible

thrombosis.risk_factors: Poor outflow, long graft, hypercoagulable state
thrombosis.prevention: Anticoagulation protocol, ensure good flow before closing

complications.liver_dysfunction: If prolonged clamp time or poor reconstruction

outcomes.median_survival: Comparable to patients without vein involvement if R0

content.statement: Portal Vein Resection and Reconstruction is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Oncovascular that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Portal Vein Resection and Reconstruction helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Portal Vein Resection and Reconstruction include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Portal Vein Resection and Reconstruction.

citations: Tseng JF, et al. Pancreaticoduodenectomy with vascular resection. Ann Surg. 2004;240(3):472-481

learning_objectives: Classify portal vein involvement by tumor extent
Describe options for portal vein reconstruction after oncologic resection
Explain conduit selection for interposition grafting
Discuss outcomes and complications of portal vein resection
clinical_pearls: Autologous vein is gold standard for interposition
Plan venous resection before dividing pancreas - assess reconstructibility
